data.text: @HeraldZimbabwe No more need for the curfew!!

Furthermore, about 710 heifers were distributed under the Presidential Heifer Pass-on Scheme to youth and are kept at 10 provincial youth incubation hubs that have been established across the country.

The national dairy milk production increased by 3.8% from 76 695 157 litres in 2020 to 79 605 552 litres in 2021.  It is pleasing to report that 790 317 stockowners benefitted from 1 000 000 kg/tick grease having been distributed under the Presidential Blitz Tick programme.
Cabinet says broiler breeders grew by 9%, day old chicks  by 19%, and broiler meat production increased by 17%.  Livestock diseases are the major cause of beef cattle, sheep and goat mortalities.

The national cattle herd recorded a growth of 0.6% from 5 478 648 cattle in 2020 to 5 509 983 in 2021. Cattle mortality rate declined from 11.1% in 2020 to 8.86% in 2021.  There was an increase in the national small ruminents and pig population: goats 7.1%; sheep 2%; & pigs 13%.
@HeraldZimbabwe Let's just wait until the figures of how much was actually looted through these schemes begin to come out.

The area under emerging crops, such as blueberries increased by 15% from 285 hectares to 328 hectares and pecan nuts increased by 36% from 550 hectares to 748 hectares in the 2021/2022 season.  Furthermore, Irish potato production increased by 9%.
